phrase.item: I wished that Nazir could fly.
I decided I need to run.
I decided that I need to run.
He decided to kill the fly.
Accepted by Husniya as equally correct as the same sentence with maʐ instead of wuzm
I chose for you to run.
Accepted by Husniya as equally correct as the same sentence with maʐ instead of wuzm
I asked myself, "Do I need to run?"
I make myself see. Lit: "I make that I see."
I don't like that you run.
I am sad that you ran.
Is this a typo or mistranscription of "gefsti"?
Willing or not, I must run.
I started to read the book.
Tomorrow I will start to read the book.
I saw him, he was running.
I saw that he was running.
I heard [from someone else] that it was raining.
It seemed to me that it was raining.
I promise that I will read the book tomorrow.
I promise to read the book.
I promise to quickly read the book.
I promised my mom that I would run tomorrow.
I promised my mom that I would run tomorrow.
I asked whether I am able to fly.
It is permitted for me to fly.
I say that we fly now. [we??]
I guess whether I will run.
I consider whether to run or not.
I wonder why he did not come.
I order you to order Alex to dance.
